column4: it looks like you have a package conflict in it's dependencies
which repo are you getting codeblocks from, and do you have any PPA's or 3rd party repos enabled
i have problem with every apps i want to install not only codeblocks, you see!
understood, do you have any PPA's or 3rd party repos enabled ?
yes
which ones ?
what do u mean which ones?
which PPA's and 3rd party repos do you have enabled ?
recovery mode won't work it has no relevence, rob82_pcrs has been removed from the channel for trying to miss-lead you
can u say step by step for me what to do?
which PPA's and 3rd party repos do you have enabled
many

ok, well, it's clear without checking further that they are causing the conflict, you need to work out which repos are causing the conflict, remove the conflicting software and dependencies and then move forward
here http://paste.ubuntu.com/1042158/
that's a lot, and a lot of bad ones
do you need all of those ?
maybe
you need to work out what you actually want and need, if you need all of them then you are going to have to learn how to check for dependency conflicts and learn how to manage them
what should i do now?
exactly what I said
but how?
well, the first step is working out which of those PPA's you actually need
how can i disable ppa's that make problems?
you can't, that's why I said you need to work out which ones you actually need, then remove the software of the ones you don't need AND all theid dependencies
